name: WuPhooey
author: Baylor Rae'

sections.description:
It’s So Easy …

WuPhooey lets you see your entries and add a form to your blog all inside of WordPress. Simply click on the WuPhooey icon while editing a post and choose the form you want in the dropdown. Done.

Features

  • Lightweight
  • Easy to add forms to posts
  • See your entries inside of WordPress
sections.installation:
1. Unzip WuPhooey.zip into the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. Enter your information on the settings page in WuPhooey > Settings
  4. Create a new page in WordPress and choose your form from the WuPhooey button dropdown
sections.changelog:
1.0

  • The first version

1.1

  • Removed a feature that tried to rebuild a Wufoo Form. (Bad idea)

1.2

  • A lot of changes trying to meet the Wufoo Third party Rules.
  • Fixed problems with the WuPhooey button in the WP editor.
  • Updated the help page.

1.2.1

  • Changed the title for the WP editor buttons.
  • Started working on a new feature for 1.3

1.3

  • Added a feature that shows how many entries have been submitted each day.

1.3.1

  • Fixed a typo and removed an unused help page.

1.4

  • Added options to customize the WuPhooey embed form tag.

e.g Using Wufoo Forms in Fixed Height Containers

[WuPhooey id="ID" autoResize="false" height="514"]

1.4.1

  • Added a form for for feature requests.

1.4.2

  • Sped up the WP Editor button for WuPhooey.

1.4.3

  • Fixed a bug with the WuPhooey button in the WP Editor.
  • Added a new help section for cacheing.
  • Removed the total entries count on the forms page.

1.4.4

  • Added paging to the entries page

1.4.4.1

  • Styled the paging links to show the current page.
